definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: An easy tip for both seeming and being more self-confidence is to speak slowly.
sentences.chinese: 对于看似和实为更自信的小诀窍就是要慢条斯理。

sentences.english: Hurstwood encountered Jessica in her dressing-room, very leisurely arranging her hair.
sentences.chinese: 在梳妆间里她看到杰西卡还在慢条斯理地梳头。

sentences.english: He always speaks slowly and acts unhurriedly.
sentences.chinese: 他说话做事总是慢条斯理的。

definition: calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)
neither too fast nor too slow (idiom)
not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
